titleStmt.title: Office of Quartermaster of U. S. Army

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: Office of Quartermaster of U. S. Army

body.p: Chief supply office for the U. S. Army. This office operated a system of field depots and a transportation network to deliver the goods to the soldiers. The Quartermaster Department assumed responsibility for burial of war dead and care of national cemeteries in 1862. Civil War-era U. S. Quartermasters General: Brigadier General Thomas Sidney Jesup (May 1818 - June 1860), Brigadier General Joseph E. Johnson (June 1860 - April 1861), Major General Montgomery C. Meigs (April 1861 - February 1882).
